title: May 2018 Android Security Bulletin Partner Preview

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In function pktlog_read of pktlog_ac.c there is a possible heap corruption due to race conditions. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with system execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In gralloc_unmap of mapper.cpp, there is a possible use after free due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to set the hnd->base_metadata correctly, preventing the issue.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In setAllowOnlyVpnForUids of NetworkManagementService.java, there is a possible security settings bypass due to a missing permission check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege allowing users to access non-VPN networks, when they are supposed to be restricted to the VPN networks, with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the missing permission check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In OMX.Nvidia.aac.decoder of Nvidia's v27 vendor library, there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the input validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_actuator_parse_i2c_params of msm_actuator.c, there is a possible OOB write due to a variable not being reset properly when an error condition occurs.  This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate NULL pointer checks and reset the total_steps variable to zero when an error occurs on copy.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the handler for command 7 of the TZ Widevine applet, there is an out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to escalation of privilege to the TZ with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the vulnerable handler.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In RewrapDeviceRsaKey of the Widevine trustlet running in the NVIDIA Tegra TZ, there is an out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to information disclosure from the TZ with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the correct bounds.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In parse_hid_report_descriptor of gtco.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds-read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_unified_link_iface_stats_event_handler of wma_utils.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a lack of bounds checking.  This could lead to local escalation of privilege if the WLAN firmware is compromised. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate bounds checking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ipa3_read_nat4 of ipa_debugfs.c, there is an out of bounds read due to an integer underflow. This could lead to information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In writeToParcel and createFromParcel of DcParamObject.java, there is a permission bypass due to a write size mismatch. This could lead to an elevation of privileges where the user can start an activity with system privileges, with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure that the read and write serialization calls match.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In SensorService::isDataInjectionEnabled of SensorService.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check in order to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sde_danger_safe_status of sde_hw_top.h, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local escalation of privilege when initializing the sde driver with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent out of bounds access when using sde_watchdog_te_status structure by using a constantly sized array definition.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_atomic_commit_dispatch of msm_atomic.c, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid checking nonblock flag in the commit packet that gets dispatched to a worker thread, in order to avoid the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several functions of sde_rotator_dev.c, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to cache the reference id in order to avoid the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In set_output_buffers of msm_vidc_common.c, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to update error handling in the function and made sure memory is freed in reverse order of allocation, for all error cases.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ipa_send_wan_msg of ipa.c, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid the use after free by having local copy and cache it upon successful return.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_pdev_div_info_evt_handler of wma.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a sanity check to make sure event->num_chains_valid is not greater than CHAIN_RSSI_NUM.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_radio_chan_stats_event_handler of wma_ocb.c, there is a possible OOB write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege if the WLAN firmware is compromised. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check to avoid OOB writes.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In a specific implementation of the TEE, there is a possible disclosure of information from speculative execution due to an unusual root cause. This could lead to local information disclosure of data secured by the TEE with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to protect against sidechannel timing attacks against speculative execution.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In pktlog_enable of linux_ac.c there is a possible use after free caused by a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper locking to avoid race condition.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In pvmp3_get_main_data_size of pvmp3_get_main_data_size.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure of global static variables with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In createFromParcel of ViewPager.java, there is a possible read/write serialization issue leading to a permissions bypass. This could lead to local escalation of privilege where an app can start an activity with system privileges with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure that the read and write serialization calls match.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_ndp_end_response_event_handler of wma_nan_datapath.c, there is a possible OOB write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform an appropriate length check to prevent the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In impeg2d_bit_stream_flush() of libmpeg2dec there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to Remote DoS with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the out of bounds read by copying inputs into an internal buffer first.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In speculative execution of the Trusted Execution Environment, there is possible memory corruption due to an unusual root cause. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to pass NS DRAM ranges to the TOS.
vulnerabilities.notes: The code snippet for CVE-2017-5715 (A-71686116) also addresses this issue.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In lo_release of loop.c, there is a possible use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_extscan_hotlist_match_event_handler of core/wma/src/wma_scan_roam.c, there is a possible OOB write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_bus_floor_vote_context of msm_bus_dbg_voter.c, there is a possible double free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_vendor_scan of wlan_hdd_scan.c, there is a possible buffer overrun due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to set the type of length variables to size_t instead of uint8_t, preventing integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In audio_effects_shared_ioctl of audio_hwacc_effects.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In csr_update_fils_params_rso of csr_api_roam.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add checks for zero values.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wmi_set_ie of wmi.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a check for the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In lim_send_sme_probe_req_ind of lim_process_probe_req_frame.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a buffer length check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In txrx_fw_stats handler of ol_txrx.c, there is a possible arbitrary memory write issue due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the proper validation to avoid an arbitrary memory write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In dcc_store_func_type of dcc_v2.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to verify that drvdata->curr_list is valid before use.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sapInterferenceRssiCount of sapChSelect.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In htt_t2h_rx_in_order_indication_handler of htt_t2h.c, there is a possible OOB write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the bounds check to num_msdus.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In hdd_ProcessGENIE of wlan_hdd_assoc.c, there is a possible buffer over-read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the return value of dot11fUnpackIeRSN.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In lim_process_fils_auth_frame2 of lim_process_fils.c, there is a possible buffer over-read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the return value from dot11fUnpackIeRSN before reading the data it provides.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In print_sparse_mem_entry of kgsl_debugfs.c, there is a possible use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_extscan_cached_results_event_handler of wma_scan_roam.c, there is a possible OOB read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add an appropriate bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In qseecom_unload_app of qseecom.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a check to prevent freeing an app entry that's still in use.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In event_handler of msm-pcm-q6-v2.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate that buf_index is less than CAPTURE_MAX_NUM_PERIODS.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In numerous functions of wma.c and wma_nan_datapath.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add appropriate bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In get_net_ns_by_id of net_namespace.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege due to incorrect reference counting with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use maybe_get_net(peer) instead of get_net(peer).

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In createFromParcel of MediaCas.java, there is a possible parcel read/write mismatch due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege where an app can start an activity with system privileges with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure that the read and write serialization calls match.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In HeifDecoderImpl::getScanline of HeifDecoderImpl.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix issues of display size and image size mismatch in order to avoid the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In readEncryptedData of ConscryptEngine.java, there is a possible plaintext leak due to improperly used crypto. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the heap buffer overreads to avoid exposing the plaintext data.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the read() function of ProcessStats.java, there is a possible read/write serialization issue leading to a permissions bypass. This could lead to local escalation of privilege where an app can start an activity with system privileges with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure that the read and write serialization calls match.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In checkPermissions of RecognitionService.java, there is a possible permissions bypass due to a missing permission check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the missing permission check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In HeifDataSource::readAt of HeifDecoderImpl.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an intgreger overflow. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In String16 of String16.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in an unprivileged process with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ElementaryStreamQueue::dequeueAccessUnitMPEG4Video of ESQueue.cpp, there is a possible infinite loop leading to resource exhaustion due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix a bounds check and update an offset, preventing the infinite loop.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Several issues in the Wi-Fi stack could lead to an elevation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to update the Qualcomm Wi-Fi stack.
vulnerabilities.notes:
The fix for this issue addresses the KRACK vulnerabilities and the following CVEs: CVE-2017-13077, CVE-2017-13078, CVE-2017-13079, CVE-2017-13080, CVE-2017-13081, CVE-2017-13082, CVE-2017-13086, CVE-2017-13087, CVE-2017-13088.

The full set of required Qualcomm CRs per product is covered in 80-YA512-36 which was released on Qualcomm's Createpoint on March 16, 2018. Partners with Qualcomm devices must check this article to determine applicable Qualcomm CRs for addressing this issue on their devices.
